column4: what is symlink ? is it exactly equalevent to shortcut in windows ?
Its similar but much more powerfull
i cant find info and how to for it...

system links are files that explorer reads and follows, where as the linux ones are built into the basic file system, so you can systemlink stuff and applications will read the file it points to rather than the systemlink file itself
If you are ok with the console 'ln -s sourcefile destinationfile', otherwise im sure theres an easy way to do it in nautilus or other filemanagers
may i create a symlink for my windows drives ? i wanna have a shortcut in my kde desktop
Yep that should work fine, just make a link to their mount points
mount point ?  you mean this ? this is my c drive in windows /dev/hda1
thats the raw device. not the mount point, check in /media
Although the sudo bit is probally not required

Its a symbolic link because of the -s http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbolic_link you use it when linking to files on the same device
